results.content: Enjoying the course so far but one thing bugging me is how quickly Brad moves on after writing some code. You need to give a little pause so people can code along without having to stop the video every few seconds or watch at a painfully slow pace. Cadence is such an overlooked aspect of making a good course.
results.content_html: Enjoying the course so far but one thing bugging me is how quickly Brad moves on after writing some code. Cadence is such an overlooked aspect of making a good course.

results.content:
This is everything I've been looking for with regards to Next.js. Having created static sites with Gatsby, I wanted to learn the Next.js way of doing that plus all the server-side stuff that one can use to flesh out full-featured applications. 

This course delivers on all of that and Brad, as always, presents the course in a very understandable and coherent way. Love it!

results.content:
Summary: very suitable for beginners in Next.

Like every Brad Traversy course, the content is taught in a very didactic way. Sometimes the videos go too fast, but nothing gets in the way of the course.

I missed a project that uses more robust Next features, such as Router and loaders. It would also be interesting to address caching and fetching with SWR.

I also missed a project that was more integrated with React's native functionality, especially more state handling with Context.
results.content_html:
Summary: very suitable for beginners in Next.

Like every Brad Traversy course, the content is taught in a very didactic way. Sometimes the videos go too fast, but nothing gets in the way of the course.

I missed a project that uses more robust Next features, such as Router and loaders. It would also be interesting to address caching and fetching with SWR.

I also missed a project that was more integrated with React's native functionality, especially more state handling with Context.

For a foundational course, it's great! I was really having a tough time on my own learning Next.js but this course was a huge help in really getting me to understand the basics. 

I never touched backend stuff before this but the instructor was able to explain what's going on well enough for me to at least not be completely lost. I still had to look up some topics like JSON Web Tokens as it's used in the course but he didnt explain it.

results.content:
I have been developing applications with React FE for about 2-3 years. I had no experience with Next JS when I started the course, I only knew a few things I heard from others. By the end of the course, I feel like I have a solid understanding of all the technologies used in the course and understand why people on the React-Hype say they might switch to NextJS. 

Strapi and Cloudinary were also 2 new things for me and I'm glad I learned about those 2 technologies as well. 

I would recommend the course to anyone who wants to have a better understanding about this stack.
results.content_html:
I have been developing applications with React FE for about 2-3 years. I had no experience with Next JS when I started the course, I only knew a few things I heard from others. By the end of the course, I feel like I have a solid understanding of all the technologies used in the course and understand why people on the React-Hype say they might switch to NextJS.

Strapi and Cloudinary were also 2 new things for me and I'm glad I learned about those 2 technologies as well.

I would recommend the course to anyone who wants to have a better understanding about this stack.

results.content: Great course, it goes at a faster pace which was perfect for me personally, and definitely went over some fantastic stuff. There's just some minor things that will give the application a 500 server error like trying to go to an authorized url when you're not logged in (dashboard), or putting an incorrect slug when trying to go to an event detail page, and you can access pages like an event edit page when not logged in, etc. Though these edge cases I didn't find to be a big deal as this project gives you a very solid foundation overall, and if you're an experienced developer these edge cases shouldn't be a problem to deal with. Overall great course and learned some neat things from it!
results.content_html: Great course, it goes at a faster pace which was perfect for me personally, and definitely went over some fantastic stuff. There's just some minor things that will give the application a 500 server error like trying to go to an authorized url when you're not logged in (dashboard), or putting an incorrect slug when trying to go to an event detail page, and you can access pages like an event edit page when not logged in, etc. Though these edge cases I didn't find to be a big deal as this project gives you a very solid foundation overall, and if you're an experienced developer these edge cases shouldn't be a problem to deal with. Overall great course and learned some neat things from it!

results.content: Incredible course that manages to cover most of the essence of NextJS with a relatively well pacing. Though sometimes I even failed to catch up with Brad, I must say he has spent quite an amount of effort in planning of his videos, which is really commendable. Long story short, definitely worth the money, whether you're a beginner or intermediate, I'm sure you will get at least something from it.

Though sometimes I even failed to catch up with Brad, I must say he has spent quite an amount of effort in planning of his videos, which is really commendable. Long story short, definitely worth the money, whether you're a beginner or intermediate, I'm sure you will get at least something from it.
